translated: MahÄyÄna PratÄ«tyasamutpÄda Treatise in One Fascicle, Composed by Ä€rya Uá¸á¸iyÄnağŸ”½Kaifuyi Tongsansi Tejin Shihonglu Qing
Su Guo Gong Shiyi Qianhu Hu Cizi Zeng Sigong
One arises from three, six arise from three,
Six from two, and six again from six, six also give rise to six.
From six there are three, and these three have three again,
Three again give rise to four, and four again give rise to three.
From three arises one, and that one again gives rise to seven,
All the suffering within this, the Sage says, is all included.
The twelve kinds of distinctions, the wise ones say are empty,
Due to the power of the links of dependent origination, one should know the twelve dharmas.
Ignorance and karma, consciousness, name and form, the three combined with the faculties,
Sensation, craving, grasping, accumulation, birth, ripening, and ending in succession.
The first, eighth, and ninth are afflictions, the second and tenth are karma,
The remaining seven are all suffering, the three encompass the twelve dharmas.
The first two are the past, the last two are the future,
The remaining eight are the present, these are called the dharmas of the three times.
Afflictions, karma, and retribution, retribution again gives rise to afflictions,
Afflictions again give rise to karma, and also due to karma there is retribution.
Apart from afflictions, how can there be karma?
Apart from karma, how can there be retribution?
Without retribution, there are no afflictions, these three are each extinguished.
The five branches of causes and effects are called afflictions and karma,
The seven branches are the effects, the seven kinds of suffering should be known.
In the cause there is no effect, in the effect there is also no cause,
In the cause there is also no cause, in the effect there is also no effect,
The wise one is in accord with the characteristic of emptiness.
Because cause and effect are combined, afflictions, karma, and effects are combined,
One should allow them to be divided into six parts.
Two sections and three summaries, cause and effect are mixed as sections,
Three or four sections are summarized in total.
There are five dharmas in the state of suffering, the doer and the storehouse realm,
The object, transformation, birth, and flow.
The outflow effect is two, in the corresponding root division,
One by one, three and two parts.
The outflow effect of transformation, in the remaining corresponding division,
Two, one, one, and one dharma.
Because of combination, dependent origination, no sentient beings, no life,
Empty without wisdom to know.
No self, in the midst of no self, the four kinds of ignorance are empty,
The remaining branches are also like this, apart from the two extremes of annihilation and permanence,
This is precisely the middle way.
The essence of enlightenment is the buddhas, having awakened in the midst of the assembly,
The sage immortals speak of no self.
The guide teaches this meaning, as stated in the KÄtyÄyana SÅ«tra,
Right view and the view of emptiness, as stated in the ParÄpariya SÅ«tra [on] the lunar mansion Ä€Å›leá¹£Ä,
Also speaks of the supreme emptiness.
They who know the characteristics of emptiness, if they do not know dependent origination,
They also do not know that emptiness.
Not giving rise to disgust towards the aggregates, they are called the emptiness of evil destinies,
Then they are confused about the meaning of dependent origination.
Free from conceit, they know emptiness, and because they are disgusted with the aggregates,
They are not confused about the fruits of karma.
Also, not not taking this as a condition, emptiness takes as a condition this
Karma, retribution, and the equipment of enjoyment.
Previously, dependent origination was already explained, those afflictions, karma, and suffering,
Among the three, as appropriate, are included. From the three, two are produced,
From the two, seven are produced, and from the seven, again three are produced.
The wheel of existence turns like this. All are causes and effects,
Arising from emptiness into emptiness, arising from Dharma into Dharma.
Afflictions arise through conditions, karma also arises through conditions,
Retribution also arises through conditions, there is not a single thing without conditions.
Recitation, lamp, seal, mirror, sound, sunlight, seed, vinegar,
The aggregates continue without changing, wisdom observes those two.
The main text of the Treatise on the Thirty on Dependent Origination is completed.
The Treatise on the Thirty on Dependent Origination, I will explain in sequence according to the order.
From one arises three, from three arises six,
From six two two again six, from six also arises six.
From one arises three means from ignorance. This ignorance is called ignorance.

Because of not being aware of suffering, accumulation, cessation, and the path, it is called ignorance. Because of this, there is meritorious, non-meritorious, and immovable, called the three kinds of actions.
And bodily actions, verbal actions, mental actions, etc. arise from their transformation.

From three arises six means that from the three karmic activities arise the six consciousnesses, namely eye consciousness, ear consciousness, nose consciousness, tongue consciousness, body consciousness, and mind consciousness.
Six and two means that those six consciousnesses give rise to two kinds, namely name-and-form.
Two and again six means that name-and-form give rise to the six sense bases, namely the eye base, ear base, nose base, tongue base, body base, and mind base.
From six also arises six means that from those six sense bases arise the six contacts, namely eye contact, ear contact, nose contact, tongue contact, body contact, and mind contact.
From six there are three, and from these three there are three again,
Three again give rise to four, and four again give rise to three.
From six there are three means that from those six contacts arise the three feelings, namely pleasant feeling, unpleasant feeling, and neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling.
These three again have three. The three are still born from those three feelings, namely, the craving for desire, the craving for existence, and the craving for non-existence.

From the three again four are born. The four are still born from those three cravings, namely, the grasping of desire, the grasping of views, the grasping of precepts and observances, and the grasping of self-doctrine.
From the four again three are born. The three are still born from those four graspings, namely, the existence of desire, the existence of form, and the existence of the formless.
From the three is born one, that one again produces seven,
Within it, all suffering, the Sage says, is included.
From the three is born one. It is still born from those three existences, producing one future birth.
That one again produces seven. It is still born from one future existence, the seven of old age, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, grief, and distress.

As for the Muni's teaching that all suffering within it is included, within it, from ignorance as the beginning to suffering as the end, immeasurable kinds of suffering are all included here by the World-Honored One in brief.
The wise one says that the twelve kinds of distinctions are empty,
One should know the twelve dharmas due to the power of the links of dependent origination.

As for the wise one saying that the twelve kinds of distinctions are empty, these distinctions such as ignorance and so forth have twelve links, and all of them are empty by nature. One should know that what is said here is only emptiness.
Dharmas are born from emptiness, and emptiness is born from dharmas. Dharmas are born due to the dharmas of the links of dependent origination.
As for one should know the twelve dharmas, if one knows the twelve dharmas in this way due to the power of the sequential arising of the links,
Among them, the characteristic of delusion is ignorance. The characteristic of accumulating future existence in the place of the phrase of those activities

is activity. The characteristic of the link of subsequent birth in the place of the phrase of that consciousness is consciousness. The characteristic ofğŸ”½the link of name-and-form in the place of that name-and-form is name-and-form.

The characteristic of the combination of the name-body and form-body is form. The characteristic of the arrangement of the faculties is the six sense bases. The characteristic of the gathering of eye, form, and consciousness is contact. The characteristic of the experience of pleasant, unpleasant, and neutral feelings is feeling. The characteristic of insatiable desire is craving. The characteristic of grasping and appropriating is grasping.

The characteristic of the combination of name and form is form. The characteristic of the arrangement of the faculties is the six sense bases. The characteristic of the gathering of eye, form, and consciousness is contact. The characteristic of the experience of what is desirable and undesirable is feeling. The characteristic of insatiable desire is craving. The characteristic of grasping and appropriating is grasping. The characteristic of name and form is existence. The characteristic of the arising of the aggregates is birth. The characteristic of maturation is old age. The characteristic of the cessation of the life faculty is death. The characteristic of agitation is sorrow. The characteristic of crying out is lamentation. The characteristic of the affliction of the body is pain. The characteristic of the affliction of the mind is distress. The characteristic of harm is all the afflictions.
Ignorance, karmic activity, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases,
Contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, aging, and death.

Among them, ignorance is the absence of knowledge, karmic activity is the practice, consciousness is the discrimination, name-and-form is the aggregation of the five aggregates, the sense bases are the sense faculties, the union of the three is contact, the experience is feeling, craving is desire, grasping is clinging, the enjoyment is becoming, arising is birth, ripening is aging, and the end is death.
Moreover, I will explain in order the distinctions and inclusion of these.
Among them, the distinctions of afflictions and karma.
The first, eighth, and ninth are afflictions, the second and tenth are karma,
The remaining seven are all suffering, the three include the twelve dharmas.
The three afflictions are ignorance, craving, and grasping.
The two karmas are karmic activity and becoming.
The seven fruits are consciousness, name-and-form, six sense bases, contact, feeling, birth, and old age and death.
These twelve factors are included in three kinds.
Moreover, they are distinguished by time.
The first two are in the past, the last two are in the future,
The remaining eight are in the present. These are called the dharmas of the three times.

Ignorance and karmic formations are the first two kinds in the past, birth and old age and death are the last two kinds in the future, and the eight kinds of consciousness, name-and-form, six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, and becoming are in the present.
Moreover, these arise sequentially from each other.
Afflictions, karma, and retribution, retribution again gives rise to afflictions,
Afflictions again give rise to karma, and also due to karma there is retribution.
The three kinds of afflictions, karma, and retribution are as explained above.

Because of those afflictions, there is karma. Because of karma, there is retribution. Still, because of retribution, there are afflictions. Because of afflictions, there is karma. Because of karma, there is retribution.
Question:
What is the meaning of the individual cessation of afflictions being exhausted?
Answer:
How can there be karma if one is separated from afflictions?
How can there be retribution if one is separated from karma?
Without retribution, one is separated from afflictions. These three are each in cessation.

If this mind is without the defilement of afflictions, then it does not accumulate karma. If one does not create karma, then one does not experience retribution. If one extinguishes retribution, then one also does not give rise to afflictions. In this way, these three are each in cessation.
Moreover, these have the aspect of cause and effect.
The five branches of cause giving rise to effects are called afflictions and karma.
The seven aspects are considered to be effects, and the seven kinds of suffering should be known.
The five causes are called afflictions and karma, which are as previously explained: ignorance, formations, craving, grasping, and becoming.

As for the seven fruits that arise in succession, they are also as the previously mentioned seven kinds of suffering, namely, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, birth, and old age and death.
Moreover, these causes and effects are both empty.
In the cause, there is no effect, and in the effect, there is also no cause.
In the cause, there is also no cause, and in the effect, there is also no effect.
The wise one is in accord with the characteristic of emptiness. The Sanskrit verse is now made into one sentence.
If these causes and effects that are spoken of are both empty in the middle, then if the cause is empty, the effect is also empty, and if the effect is empty, the cause is also empty.
The cause is empty, the cause is also empty, the effect is empty, and the effect is also empty. One should be in accord with these four phrases.
Moreover, there is further analysis of this.
In the world, there are four kinds of factors, which exist due to the combination of causes and effects.
The combination of afflictions, karma, and fruits should be acknowledged as the six factors.
The four kinds in the world are combined with causes and effects, so there are four kinds. The four kinds are divided into four parts in order.
Among them, ignorance and action are the first two dharmas in the past time, which are the first part.
Consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, and feeling are in the present time, which is the second part.
Craving, grasping, and becoming are also in the present time, which is the third part.
Birth and old age and death are the two dharmas in the future time, which is the fourth part.
This is called the four parts.
The afflictions, karma, and fruits are divided into six parts. The three kinds of afflictions, karma, and retribution are combined into two roots, which become six parts.
Among them, from ignorance to feeling have ignorance as the root, and from craving to old age and death have craving as the root.

In the root of ignorance, ignorance belongs to the category of afflictions, while formations belong to the category of karma, and consciousness, name-and-form, six sense bases, contact, and feeling belong to the category of retribution.

In the root of craving, craving and grasping belong to the category of afflictions, while becoming belongs to the category of karma, and birth, old age, and death belong to the category of retribution.
Moreover, the sections are summarized in general.
Because they are included in the sections, there are two sections and three summaries.
Cause and effect are mixed in the sections, and the third and fourth sections are summarized in general.
Existence is the basis, giving rise to two sections, namely, the first section between existence and birth, and the second section between formations and consciousness.
These two sections are both sections of karmic results.
In feeling and craving, cause and effect are mixed together, which is the third section.
These three sections are further summarized into four types.
Ignorance and formations are the first summary.
Consciousness, name-and-form, six sense bases, contact, and feeling are the second summary.
Craving, grasping, and becoming are the third general summary.
Birth and old age and death are the fourth general summary.
This is called the three sections and four general summaries.
Moreover, within these dharmas, there are distinctions of stages and times.
Two, three, two, three, two - the stage of suffering has five dharmas,
The doer, the womb, the realm, the turning of the object, and the flow of arising.
As for dharmas, ignorance and karmic formations are said to be two kinds.
Consciousness, name-and-form, and the six sense bases are said to be three kinds.
Contact and feeling are said to be two kinds.
Craving, grasping, and becoming are said to be three kinds.
Moreover, birth and old age and death are said to be two kinds.
These five dharmas are the doer, the womb, the object, the turning of the object, and the arising and flowing within the stage of suffering, as should be known according to the text.

Among them, the two kinds of ignorance and action are said to be the creators in the state of suffering, the three kinds of consciousness, name-and-form, and the six sense bases are said to be the embryo in the state of suffering, the two kinds of contact and feeling are said to be the objects in the state of suffering, the three kinds of craving, grasping, and becoming are said to be the instigators in the state of suffering, and the two kinds of birth, old age, and death are said to be the processes in the state of suffering.
Moreover, there are distinctions in the fruits.
The fruits of delusion, instigation, retribution, and continuity are two,
Corresponding to the divisions of faculties, each has three and two parts.
As explained above, this ignorance and craving, in the initial part of the ignorance, have four kinds of fruits: the fruits of delusion, instigation, retribution, and continuity.
The paths of the numbers one, three, and two should correspond to them in order.

Among them, ignorance is the fruit of delusion, action is the fruit of instigation, consciousness, name-and-form, and the six sense bases are the fruit of retribution, and contact and feeling are the fruit of continuity.
There are also other remaining fruits.
The fruits of heat, deficiency, and shortness, the fruits of transformation and outflow,
In the corresponding remaining parts, two, one, and one dharma each.

As explained above, in the second part of the root of craving, the fruits of heat, deficiency, shortness, transformation, and outflow, according to their number, two, one, and one each, should correspond to these dharmas.
Among them, craving and grasping are the fruits of heat, existence is the fruit of deficiency, birth is the fruit of transformation, and old age and death are the fruits of outflow.
Thus, these are the eight fruits.
These have twelve kinds, because of the combination, dependent origination,
No sentient beings, no life, empty and without, to be known with wisdom.

Thus, ignorance, the ancient translation of which is ignorance, is now correctly ignorance. It is the beginning, and old age and death are the end. There are twelve links, which combine and arise in dependence on each other.
But there are no sentient beings, no life force, and it is empty and nonexistent, one should understand with wisdom.
Among them, there are no sentient beings because they are not solid.
There is no life force because there is no self.
Emptiness means there is no creator, because there is no creator.
No self, no possession of self, no self, and no self in the midst of self,
Four kinds of ignorance are empty, and the remaining limbs are also like this.
Ignorance is no-self.
Here, ignorance is no-possession of self, because there is no self, and in the midst of no-self, there is no ignorance.
In the midst of the four kinds of no-possession of ignorance, there is also no emptiness of ignorance.
Just as the four kinds of ignorance are empty in sequence, one should understand that the remaining limbs such as karmic formations are also all empty in the same way.
Free from the two extremes of annihilation and permanence, this is the middle way,
If one has already accomplished realization, the essence of realization is the buddhas.
Existence is the extreme of permanence, non-existence is the extreme of annihilation. These two extremes arise from this cause, and therefore arise from that condition.
In the midst of those existences, if one departs from the two extremes, one then enters the middle way.
If one does not know this meaning, then the non-Buddhists fall into the two extremes.
If one awakens to this, then one is all the buddhas, just as the buddhas are able to accomplish this in the world, unlike others.
Having awakened, in the midst of the assembly, the sage-immortal speaks of no-self,
As previously in the Sutra on the Parable of the City, the guide spoke of this meaning.
That is also the middle way in this context. Having awakened, the Buddha speaks of no-self and no possession of self in the midst of the assembly.
You bhiká¹£us should know that those who cling to self and possession of self are foolish, ignorant, ordinary people with little learning.
They follow the provisional designations and further cling to self and possession of self.
When a bhiká¹£u is born, it is only suffering that is born; when he ceases, it is only suffering that ceases.
As previously spoken of by the guide in the Sutra on the Parable of the City, this is the meaning.
Moreover:
The KÄtyÄyanÄvavÄda SÅ«tra says, Right view and the view of emptiness,
The PrajÃ±aptiÅ›Ästra also speaks of the supreme emptiness.
The World-Honored One has extensively explained these characteristics in these three sÅ«tras and elsewhere.
If one correctly understands dependent origination, one will understand emptiness.
If one does not understand dependent origination, one will also not understand emptiness.
If one correctly understands dependent origination as explained above, one will understand without error.
What does one understand?
It means understanding emptiness.
If one does not understand dependent origination, one will also not understand emptiness. If one does not understand dependent origination, one will also not be able to penetrate emptiness.
If one is arrogant about emptiness, one will not be disgusted with the aggregates.
If one has the view of non-existence, one will be confused about the meaning of dependent origination.
If one is arrogant about emptiness, one will not be disgusted. If one is arrogant about emptiness, one will not give rise to disgust towards the five aggregates.

If one is deluded about the meaning of dependent origination due to not seeing that, then one will grasp any of the four views among the four views: the view of annihilation, the view of permanence, the view of being created by an omnipotent being, and the view of everything being created by past karma.
Because of not being deluded about dependent origination, one is free from arrogance and knows emptiness.
And because of being disgusted with the aggregates, one is not deluded about the fruits of karma.

Because of not being deluded about dependent origination, one is free from arrogance and knows emptiness. If one is without a deluded mind in the various dependent originations explained above, and if one attains freedom from arrogance in grasping at I and mine, then one will be able to enter emptiness in accordance with the Dharma.

And because of being disgusted with the aggregates, one is not deluded about the fruits of karma. Because of grasping at I and mine within the five aggregates, one wanders endlessly throughout the world.
Because of being disgusted with those aggregates, one is without error and not deluded regarding the continuity of the fruits of karma.
Moreover, what does this mean?
Karma creates conditions for continuation of birth, and also does not not rely on this.
The empty conditions will have this, the equipment of karmic retribution and enjoyment.

Karma creates conditions for continuation of birth and also does not not rely on this means that the afflictions, karma, and retribution are as explained above. By means of such good and bad karma, beings are driven to continue in succession above and below. If it were not for this karma, it would not create conditions.
If it were not so, then one would not create karma and receive retribution, or having created karma, would lose it.

The empty conditions will have this karmic retribution and enjoyment equipment means that if by means of such good and bad karma there is retribution and enjoyment, the intrinsic nature is empty and originally without self. The creation of conditions and the arising of that empty nature should also be understood.
The meaning of that is now briefly explained.
The distinctions of the twelve links have already been explained as dependent origination.
Within the three of afflictions, karma, and suffering, they are categorized according to the Dharma.
Ignorance is the beginning, and old age and death are the end. These twelve links of dependent origination are the distinctions of arising from conditions, as explained above.
Among them, three are afflictions, two are karma, and seven are suffering, all of which have already been included.
From the three arises the two, from the two arises the seven,
From the seven again arises the three, the wheel of existence turns like this.

The two kinds of action produced by the three kinds of ignorance, craving, and grasping give rise to the seven links of consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, birth, and old age and death.
Among those seven links, as explained above, they give rise to the three kinds again, and from those three come the two again, and then the seven.
Therefore, the two kinds continue in sequence without interruption. The wheel of existence turns like this.
Causes and effects give rise to the worlds, there are no separate sentient beings,
Only empty dharmas give rise to empty dharmas.

As for causes and effects give rise to all worlds, there are no separate sentient beings, the five kinds of causes are ignorance, karmic formations, craving, grasping, and becoming, and the seven kinds of effects are consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, birth, and old age and death.

All of these pervade the world. Whether it is a self, a sentient being, a life, a living being, a person, a human, or an agent, these discriminations are only false and deceptive, and one should know this.
How do they arise?

It is only that empty dharmas give rise to empty dharmas themselves. This means that in the emptiness of self-nature, there are only the empty names of afflictions, karma, and fruits. Only the empty names of afflictions, karma, and fruits give rise to dharmas. This is the meaning.
Afflictions arise based on conditions, karma also arises based on conditions,
Retribution also arises based on conditions, there is not a single one that does not have conditions.

If there are afflictions, then there are various immeasurable karmas and various karmas that produce results. One should know that they all arise from common conditions, and there is not a single dharma that lacks causes and conditions.
Moreover, in order to clarify that meaning, I will now give another analogy.
Recitation, lamp, seal, mirror, sound, sunlight, seeds, vinegar,
Many continuations do not transfer, the wise should observe those two.

Like recitation, there is the one who teaches recitation and the one who receives recitation. The recitation that is taught does not transfer to the recitation that is received. Why is it that the one who teaches recitation still remains? Because of remaining, the one who teaches recitation also does not continue.
Why is this?
Because it is not self-sufficient.
Like a lamp that arises in sequence, it is not the transfer of the first lamp, nor does the second arise without a cause.
The two of seal and image, face and mirror, sound and echo, sun and fire, seed and sprout, and vinegar and saliva are like this.
These two kinds do not move, are not unborn, and are not born without a cause.
The continuity of the five aggregates of these two kinds is transmitted in sequence, not the first aggregate moving, and the second aggregate is not unborn, and is not born without a cause.
The wise should contemplate correctly that the continuity of these aggregates is not moving.
Moreover, there are ten kinds of internal and external correspondences, all of which should be known.

Among them, the ten kinds of external [characteristics] are: 1) because of impermanence, 2) because of non-cessation, 3) because of non-transference, 4) because of the connection between cause and effect without an intermediary, 5) because of not being its substance, 6) because of non-difference, 7) because of the absence of an agent, 8) because of not being without a cause, 9) because of momentary cessation, 10) because of the connection between cause and effect of the same kind.

Because the external seeds are completely destroyed without remainder, the sprout is not permanent. Because the seeds are completely destroyed without remainder, the sprout is not annihilated. Because the sprout did not exist before but now exists, it is not transferred. Because the continuity of cause and effect is uninterrupted, it is not severed. Because there is no intermediate difference between the seed and sprout, it is not the same. Because it does not arise from its own essence, it is not a different cause. Because the seed is the cause without an agent, it is not without cause. Because the seed, sprout, stem, branches, leaves, flowers, fruits, etc. are produced in succession without cause, it is not a transformation. Because sweet, sour, salty, bitter, pungent, and astringent tastes arise in succession according to the differences in causes, it is not a reversion.
The internal ten kinds of connections with similar effects are: First, because the aggregates at the end of death are completely destroyed without remainder, they are not permanent.
Second, because the aggregates of the subsequent stage of birth are obtained, they are not annihilated.

Third, because the aggregates at the end of death are completely destroyed without remainder, and the aggregates of the subsequent stage of birth did not exist before but now exist, they are not transferred.
Fourth, the continuity of the aggregates is uninterrupted, with cause and effect succeeding each other, so there is no middle;
Fifth, the differences in the aggregates of the limbs of existence immediately after death do not constitute its essence;
Sixth, because it arises from that, it is not separate;
Seventh, because the causes and conditions are combined, there is no creator;
Eighth, because afflictions and karma are the causes, it is not without causes;
Ninth, the kalala, arbuda, peÅ›in, ghana, praÅ›ÄkhÄ, birth from the womb, infant, child, youth, and elder, etc., are born in succession, so they are momentary;
Tenth, it is perfumed by good and evil.
Because the fruit turns out according to the differences in the causes, it is bound by the characteristics of the fruit of the same type.
There are also three verses:
Just as a flame is born and extinguished, so is the body of consciousness,
The past and future are also without accumulation.
Although unborn, there is birth, and destruction is not a combination,
The arising is also without abiding, yet this activity continues.
If one is able to contemplate and understand emptiness in relation to dependent origination,
If one understands the designation, then one accords with the middle way.

In the middle, ignorance, action, craving, grasping, and becoming are the truth of accumulation; consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, birth, and old age and death are the truth of suffering.

The twelve links, the truth of the path is the means to realize the cessation of those, namely the mindfulnesses, right efforts, bases of supernatural power, faculties, powers, factors of awakening, and eightfold noble path are called the truth of the path.
Treatise on MahÄyÄna Dependent Origination in one fascicle
